metadata.title: CVE-2022-2571 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.0101.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2571` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-athena - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-gtk3 - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-gui-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-motif - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-nox - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-runtime - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-tiny - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
xxd - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: rodrigo-zaiden> in versions prior than focal, the suspected code can be found in src/edit.c. A more careful analysis would be needed to determine if those versions are vulnerable.

criterions.comment: vim package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1').
